message_1:
What is the crossing number of the knot shown below?

![knot image](https://i.stack.imgur.com/GgHNz.png)

Note: The crossing number of a knot is the least number of crossings that can be used to represent the knot.
message_2: The knot shown in the image is known as the "figure-eight knot" or "4_1 knot" in knot theory. The crossing number of the figure-eight knot is 4. This means that the least number of crossings that can be used to represent this knot is 4.
